suncertify.db
Class URLyBirdSchema

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.URLyBirdSchema
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, TableSchema
public final class URLyBirdSchema
extends java.lang.Object
implements TableSchema

Table-specific information about the format of the fields. Each Field has a parser, which can convert a String into a Field and vice versa. Meta-data for each field is given in a .properties file. Property keys consist of the field name appended with .type, .modifiable, .searchable, or .displayable, and a value that is not true or yes will be interpreted as false. Type may be one of the following:

  • string
  • integer
  • date
  • boolean
  • currency
Example: 
 owner.type=integer
 owner.modifiable=true
 owner.searchable=false
 owner.displayable=true
By default, a field is of type string, and is displayable but not searchable or modifiable.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

URLyBirdSchema

public URLyBirdSchema(java.util.List<java.lang.String> fieldNames,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> fieldLengths)
Create a new instance. Each field will have its maximum length set to the corresponding value in fieldLengths

Parameters:
fieldNames - the name of each field.
fieldLengths - the maximum length (in characters) of each field. Any element may be null, in which case the length of the corresponding field will be unbounded.
